text.0_Chapter, 4_Verse: I am black but comely, O daughters of Jerusalem! Like the tents of Kedar, like the curtains of Solomon.
text.1_Chapter, 6_Verse: I adjure you, O daughters of Jerusalem, by the gazelles or by the hinds of the field, that you neither awaken nor arouse the love while it is desirous.
text.4_Chapter, 6_Verse: The watchmen who patrol the city found me; they smote me and wounded me; the watchmen of the walls took my jewelry off me.
